releases.name: go-maven-poller-2.0.6 (DO NOT USE!)
releases.body:
# Release 2.0.6
## Changes

**THERE ARE REPORTS THAT HTTPS CONNECTIONS FAIL WITH 'Invalid Proxy'. DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS RELEASE!**
**See [HTTPCLIENT-2308](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-2308) for more details.**

* Now using dependabot for dependency / plugin updates
* Updated dependencies: lombok, httpclient5, jetty (test)
* Multiple updated build plugins

## Checksums

|----|--------------|
|MD5|`8a8d76ad8e9c5ffc4e3dd55149a69e74`|
|SHA256|`e9417729712edf56020b0375803a9941f7f43f18b691717108f76821c6c3f091`|

releases.name: go-maven-poller-2.0.1
releases.body:
# Release 2.0.1
## Changes

* Update of httpclient5 dependency fixing a memory leak. Original text from Apache project: "This is an emergency release that fixes a regression introduced in the previous release that can lead to a connection leak when executing requests with a non-repeatable streaming entity with the classic (blocking) HttpClient. Async and minimal HttpClient implementations are not affected by the regression.".
* Update of gson dependency.
* Update of jetty (test) dependency.
* Update of company name to IONOS SE.

## Checksums
|Type|Message digest|
|----|--------------|
|MD5|`4bd28b8cd1e836e7480c544e311e11d1`|
|SHA256|`e36673dcf2488b1cc96978f46c87e43d7a9d19a3dda496fdc907fb909ccd6f80`|

releases.name: go-maven-poller-2.0.0
releases.body:
# Release 2.0.0
## Changes

* **Minimal GoCD version is now v20.1.0.** For older GoCD versions, keep using go-maven-poller v1.5.x.
* Drop of legacy JDK 8 support.
* Build with JDK 11 for JDK 11 targets.
* Update dependencies gson and httpclient5.

## Checksums
|Type|Message digest|
|----|--------------|
|MD5|`dfddd6feef9d300256a48b6b0127b81b`|
|SHA256|`245680dbb368a22d4cf535ac432c38a3a0b48202bcbc215171bfb936a2e8e67f`|

releases.name: go-maven-poller-1.5.3
releases.body:
# Release 1.5.3
## Changes

* Minor code cleanups.
* Minor dependency updates that affect the build (Lombok, JUnit, PowerMock, Jetty).
* Build is now driven by Github Actions.

## Checksums
|Type|Message digest|
|----|--------------|
|MD5|`80c6d894c33d64c5681c00aea8870541`|
|SHA256|`d25e5b83f2391ebad1dd89b8fb7df2071a632d8ace61ded9509f659651f2d299`|

releases.name: Updated dependencies
releases.body:
Updated dependencies for
* Lombok
* Apache HttpClient
* Apache Commons-IO
* JUnit
* PowerMock
* Jetty

releases.name: Minor refactorings
releases.body:
* Refactor from extending GoCD classes to implementing the GoPlugin interface for decoupling.
* Fix some SonarLint warnings.
* Take Target-GoCD version from POM property.

releases.name: Security: Disable XML external entity processing
releases.body:
* Disable XML external entity processing to not have [XXE](https://owasp.org/www-community/vulnerabilities/XML_External_Entity_(XXE)_Processing) attacks from remote pom files. In very unlikely cases it is possible that POM files can not be read anymore. Please open an issue in such a case.
* Minor refactorings.

releases.name: New packaging, new Apache HTTP Client
releases.body:
* Different JAR packaging: No longer using a so-called fat-JAR, but a JAR complying the plugin packaging of GoCD.
* Bugfix for old packaging mechanism (see #22 ).
* Migrate repository polling to Apache HTTP Client 5.0 (was 4.5)
* Update multiple dependencies
* Many refactorings
* Tests for HTTP Basic Authentication
* Releases are published to [Maven central](https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/oneandone/go-maven-poller/) now. You can get your releases with the go-maven-poller ;-).

**Note:** The JARs name changed due to the new packaging! The new plugin JAR is now called ` go-maven-poller-plugin.jar`. Please remember to remove the old plugin when replacing it with a new one.

releases.name: JDK 11 + updated dependencies
releases.body:
* Builds now with JDK 11, also unit tests are working.
* Updated several dependencies.
* Travis CI is now using a matrix build on multiple JDK versions.
* Fixed DateFormatPattern issue with de/serialization contributed by @Germandrummer92

* Removed support for Java 7. New Go CD Target version is set to 17.1
  * Fixed performance issue with Integer.valueOf(String)
  * Switched to Java 8 Time API
  * Updated dependency 
    * Replaced depreciation of [HttpParms](https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-core-ga/httpcore/apidocs/org/apache/http/params/HttpParams.html) by [RequestConfig.Builder](https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-client-ga/httpclient/apidocs/org/apache/http/client/config/RequestConfig.Builder.html) (Apache HttpComponents)
  * Implement additional parameter for polling latest version from specified tag inside maven-metadata.xml (#13) Contributed by @piotr-kaczmarczyk

- Fixed connection repository connection test (description in issue #11)
  - Connection test is now performed by HTTP `HEAD` and `GET` to increase performance
  - The `Accept` header is set to `*/*` on the repository base URL in order to fix the problem
- Lombok version update

Minor fixes including ...
- Check Repo configuration error message when specified URL is missing (was `MalformedURLException`)
- Changed error log message to debug when `getLatest` returns `null`, which is usually the case
- Fixed vendor information

Fix for issue #9.
- _SNAPSHOT_ versions will now be polled
- Update timestamps will be set for each artifact
- _Time zone_ property added to Repository configuration in order to get correct update timestamps

Updated dependencies and added `go.plugin-settings.get-configuration` request support (though current GoCD version 16.3 is unable to parse an empty JSON response).

GoCD target version was set to _16.3_.
Drop `go-maven-poller.jar` into `plugins/external` directory of your Go Server (usually located in `/var/lib/go-server`) in order to install this plugin
